title: Download Block Bodies extremely slow (possibly due to constantly kicking peers)
body:
#### System information

erigon version 2.42.0-stable-d8d04663

OS & Version: Debian 11

Commit hash: d8d04663

Erigon Command (with flags/config):
~~~
---
 datadir: "/mnt/data/erigon"
 chain: "mainnet"
 nat: "extip:212.159.67.48"
 prune: htc
 prune.r.before: 11184524
 identity: Kryptstar
 externalcl: true
 snapshots: true
 staticpeers: enode://68775461f6e590e4216d607e77efb70a24bb8b7c7da9c547a860e6fa27b3268ffdab1c10435a8892daebc29bcb36709e440c6038852e5626922a61c26c113086@192.168.1.94:30304
 authrpc.addr: 192.168.1.95
 authrpc.vhosts: ethnode
~~~

Consensus Layer: Lighthouse

Consensus Layer Command (with flags/config):

Chain/Network: mainnet

#### Expected behaviour

Download block bodies and add to database with normal speed

#### Actual behaviour

Progress is extremely slow, impossible to catch up with the top of chain. Possible cause is that peers are constantly being kicked.
